Params[3]: Hey, are you sure this is the way? And why aren't you flying me there if you have wings...
Roland slows down and sighs, complaining intentionally—he has to figure out a way to stall and get rid of the woman before him.
Fine by me. As long as you're not worried about falling from the sky and turning into a piece of junk.
Come on! I'm your comrade, am I not? Is that how you treat your comrades? How concerning...
Boy! You're not one of us! You stay around Mister because of your own agenda! We've never considered you as our comrade!
Why do you insist on finding that agent? She has lost all her power. She should be worth nothing to you.
Roland smiles. From Voodoo's inept probing, he is sure that this woman is here to keep an eye on him instead of accompanying him—her acting still has a long way to go.
Luna lost her power but not her status as an agent, which means Ascnet hasn't completely rejected her. If I can find her, perhaps I can find a way to obtain that status from her...
And there it is: the perfect lie is always an ounce of falsehood enshrouded in truth. Now, he just needs to find out if Voodoo will be convinced.
You? Madness! More so than us!
Is it now? At least, I think it's a decent goal to aim for. Otherwise, what fun there is to stay alive...
Voodoo suddenly stops, and Roland also pauses.
We're here. It's underneath this ruin...
Roland observes his surrounding quietly. Nothing is out of the ordinary—that said, there were plenty of opportunities on their way here for Voodoo to strike had she wanted.
Sigh... Finally. What a terrible journey that has been!
We would've been here sooner had you not been complaining.
Roland shrugs dramatically before following Voodoo into the ruins.
